rajawali.materials.plugins

Interface IMaterialPlugin

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SkeletalAnimationMaterialPlugin, SpriteSheetMaterialPlugin, VertexAnimationMaterialPlugin

    public interface IMaterialPlugin
    A material plugin is a container for a vertex and fragment shader. It can be plugged into the Material class so it can be assembled into the main shader. They can be used for skeletal animation, custom vertex animation effects, fragment shader effects, etc. Usage example: 
    
 material.addPlugin(new MyMaterialPlugin());
    Author:
    dennis.ippel

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IShaderFragment getFragmentShaderFragment()
      Returns the fragment shader fragment.
      Material.PluginInsertLocation getInsertLocation()
      Where to insert the plugin.
      IShaderFragment getVertexShaderFragment()
      Returns the vertex shader fragment.

    • Method Detail

      • getInsertLocation

        Material.PluginInsertLocation getInsertLocation()
        Where to insert the plugin. The Material class needs to know at what location the shader fragments should be inserted when assembling the shaders. The locations are defined in the Material.PluginInsertLocation enum.
        Returns:

      • getVertexShaderFragment

        IShaderFragment getVertexShaderFragment()
        Returns the vertex shader fragment. This should only be used by the Material class.
        Returns:

      • getFragmentShaderFragment

        IShaderFragment getFragmentShaderFragment()
        Returns the fragment shader fragment. This should only be used by the Material class.
        Returns:
